page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Tottington's Dungeon}is not in use anymore, and when it was in use, it was a small triangular shape with a small steel door and not a lot of room inside.It would hold about six people, and inside it were those arm and leg shackles with a stone bench to sleep or sit on. It was not a real dungeon, it was used for all the drunks and the ones who cause trouble.The constable was not a real policeman but a voluntary job.The constable is reputed to have left the doors of the dungeon open and let the prisoners escape to save him the job of taking them to court. In 1964, Salford folk museum wanted to take it stone by stone off Tottington's hands, but the locals wanted to preserve it as a link with the past, and to keep it as a monument.
